attachments.pdf.compliance.checklist.lin: Check here the PDF compliance checklist
attachments.pdf.compliance.checklist.tex:
To guarantee compliance, you should ensure that your PDF generator and resulting PDFs meet the following criteria:

• all fonts are embedded (exception: Base 14 fonts are accepted even if they are not embedded)
• the page size is A4 +/- 5% (PDF sizes up to 312 x 227 mm (A4 +5%) or 12.28 x 8.94" (letter + 5%) are accepted).
• the PDF is not encrypted
• it does not contain colour or greyscale images and drawings
• the PDF is Version 1.1 (or later)
• the PDF does not contain embedded OLE objects
• the PDF should not be electronically signed (exception: certified copies of priority documents that comply with the Administrative Instructions under the PCT, Part 7 and Annex F and may be digitally signed; they may only be filed via Online Filing or new online filing (CMS) - for further details see OJ EPO 2018, A94).
Note: US priority documents can be submitted in A4 format only.

If you are generating PDFs from paper documents using your company scanner you should adjust the settings of your scanner accordingly.

To help you verify whether the PDF document you intend to attach complies with these requirements, you can use WIPO’s PDF conversion checker:

https://pct.wipo.int/DocConverter/pages/pdfValidator.xhtml

validation.applicationNumber.european.pa: The European patent application number consists of 8 digits and 1 check digit, separated by a "." e.g. 21123456.2
validation.applicationNumber.national.pa: The national patent application number consists out of 7 digits and has the format: yyyy nnn (year + 3 digits). Example: 2002 123.
validation.applicationNumberContainer.ep: Application or publication number is required
validation.date.maxDate: Date should not be after the maximal date
validation.default.username.pattern: Only letters, digits and spaces are allowed and the following special characters . @ -
validation.number.max.value.allowed: Value should be lower or equal than {{value}}
validation.number.min.value.allowed: Value should be greater or equal than {{value}}
validation.patentNumber.pattern-epval-sa: The Application publication number/patent number should have the format EPnnnnnnn
validation.patentNumber.pattern-spc-sa: The SPC number should have the format C nnnn, C nnnn-n, C nnnnnnn or C nnnnnnn-n
validation.patentNumber.pattern-np-sa: The Patent number should have the format nnnn
validation.personalCode.pattern: The personal code should be exactly 11 digits.
validation.property.amended-date.in-rang: The translation of the amended European Patent after opposition (B2) must be submitted within 3 months from the publication of amended patent or 5 months if a time limit extension has been requested.
validation.property.limited-date.in-rang: The translation of the limited European Patent (B3) must be submitted within 3 months from the publication of limited patent or 5 months if a time limit extension has been requested.
validation.property.application-number.p: The application number should have the format nnnnnnnn.n
validation.property-application-number.p: The European patent application number consists of 8 digits and 1 check digit, separated by a '.' e.g. 21123456.2
validation.property.application-number.p: The SPC application number should comply with the format: PA yyyy nnn (PA following with year + 3 digits). Example: PA 2002 123
The application number should have the format yyyy nnn
validation.property.filing-date.in-range: Filing date should not be older than 3 months
validation.property.filing-date.should-b: Filing date should be older than Application publication date
Filing date should be older than Grant date
validation.property.grant-date.in-range: Grant date should not be older than 5 months
validation.property.publication-number.e: Publication number should match the pattern - EP followed by 7 digits
validation.property.publication-number.n: Publication number should match the pattern: nnnn
validation.property.publication-number.p: Publication number should match the pattern: nnnn or EP followed by 7 digits
validation.property.title-of-invention-a: Title of invention as published is required
validation.property.title-of-invention-h: Title of invention in local language is required
validation.publicationNumber.european.pa: The European publication number should comply with the format: EP following 7 digits (example: EP1234567).
validation.publicationNumber.national.pa: The publication number consists out of 4 digits (example: 1234).
validation.registrationCode.pattern: The registration code should be exactly 9 digits.
validation.service.page.accounted: Each page should be accounted for.
validation.service.page.range: "To page" number cannot be smaller than "From page"
validation.service.user-reference-used: This user reference is already used by your organisation, are you sure you want to use this user reference?
validation.spcApplicationNumber.pattern: The SPC application number should comply with the format: PA yyyy nnn (PA following with year + 3 digits). Example: PA 2002 123.
validation.spcCertificateNumber.pattern: The SPC certificate number should comply with the format: C nnnn, C nnnn-n, C nnnnnnn or C nnnnnnn-n. Example C 5563
validation.userReference.pattern: Only letters, digits and spaces are allowed and the following special characters . , < > = _ "" - ( ) / \
